1.text_: The shadow of an alien creature flickers against a dirt wall.:<TAP>

Deep in a mine that was sealed off centuries ago,
he waits in perfect silence.:<TAP>
\nBefore him is an ancient dragon—an exceptionally diabolical creature.:<TAP>

The dragon notices the intruder and gives a mighty roar
that causes the mineshaft to shudder violently.:<TAP>
\nA moment later, its throat begins to glow red with fire.:<TAP>
\n\nThe battle has finally begun.:<PAGE>
Two hours later...:<PAGE>
MISSION COMPLETE!:<TAP>
\n\nGolden letters flash on the monitor.:<TAP>
\nAs the dragon lies motionless on the ground,\nthe adventurers raise their swords and staves high.:<TAP>
\nThe fanfare is accompanied by a blizzard of dazzling particle effects.:<TAP>

Inside a dimly-lit room, the effects reflect off the glasses
of a man facing his computer.:<PAGE>
He is deep into a raid in an MMO.:<TAP>
\nIt is an incredibly popular title, with a player base nearing\nalmost one million members.:<TAP>

The man and his fellow party members have vanquished
the Ancient Dragon—which the most recent patch dropped
as the game's newest, most powerful enemy.:<PAGE>
The group chat is flying with the exclamations of his online friends.:<TAP>
\nEveryone is reveling in their victory.:<TAP>
\n\nnice work all:<TAP>
\nsry I died so many times:<TAP>
\nThis was our first time seeing this, so it's okay!!!:<TAP>
\nwe won so its fine LOL:<TAP>
\nit was pretty much just Levania taking the stage tho haha:<PAGE>
The man's avatar is an alien creature named Levania.:<TAP>
\nIt is, of course, only his character's name—not his own.:<PAGE>
The man types a message out to the party.:<TAP>
\nFor me, this isn't a game.:<TAP>
\n\nThey retort with their own good-natured jabs.:<TAP>
\nYUP there it is! He said it!:<PAGE>
What the man—no, what Levania said—\nwas just an act for his friends.:

The party has been raiding together for some time,
and they have an easy camaraderie among themselves.:<TAP>
\n\nTheirs is a relationship of inside jokes among informal friends.:<PAGE>
But everyone knows the man had been the key figure\nin taking down the dragon.:<TAP>
\nWithout him, they likely would not have been victorious.:<PAGE>
As the hands of the clock tick past one in the morning, his friends slowly begin returning to the real world.:<TAP>
\n\nalright I'm out:<TAP>
\nnight!:<TAP>
\ni've gotta get up at 6 lol:<TAP>
\nI'm going to bed too!:<TAP>
\nlater!:<PAGE>
The man types "See you tomorrow," and logs out.:<TAP>
\n\nRegardless of how hard he works in the game, reality always claws its way back.:<TAP>
\n\nThe man gleefully crawls into bed and removes his glasses.:<PAGE>
The next morning...:<TAP>
\nThe man stands on the train, moving his tired, \nempty eyes across the crowd packed in around him.:<TAP>
\n\nI'm sleepy, he thinks. I'm tired. I want to go home.:
\nAs these thoughts cycle through his head,\nthe train pulls up to the station near his office.:<TAP>

The man works as a mid-level engineer for a start-up IT venture
called Dull, Inc.—the same job he's held for the past four years.:<PAGE>
Each department holds a team huddle before starting the day.:<TAP>

The meetings are an excuse for bosses to talk,
check in on progress, announce schedule changes, and so forth.:<PAGE>
As the man's boss drones on and on, he tunes him out\nand thinks back to the raid of the night before.:<TAP>
\n\nHe wonders what his actions in battle looked like to his friends.:<TAP>
\n\nHad he successfully played the part of Levania?:<PAGE>
Whenever he plays him, his personality changes.:<TAP>
\n\nLevania is a leader who takes initiative;:<TAP>
\none who cracks wise with a keen sense of humor.:<TAP>
\nSomeone his companions can be honest with;:<TAP>
\na person both trustworthy and charismatic.:<TAP>
\n\nBut this person—this role—only exists in the game.:<PAGE>
In reality, the man is Levania's exact opposite.:<TAP>
\n\nHe is introverted, stoic, and lacks even one true friend.:<TAP>
\nHe communicates only as much as necessary to get by in society,\nand has no desire to take any of his relationships deeper.:<TAP>

Additionally, he is plagued by a vague, smoldering dissatisfaction of
how unfair and irrational modern society is.:<PAGE>
The only thing that brings him joy are games.:<TAP>
\nWhether he is playing the work of another or crafting his own,\nit is the only time he ever experiences happiness.:<TAP>

His own game—which he's been working on in his spare time—
was reaching completion.:<TAP>

It is an old-fashioned RPG where the player takes on the role of
hero to save a princess captured by the demon king.:<TAP>
\n\nAnd of course, the hero's name is Levania.:<PAGE>
"Hey! You listening!?":<TAP>
\n\nThe man suddenly snaps back to reality.:<TAP>
\nThe team huddle is still going on.:<TAP>

He sputters out a half-whispered apology for daydreaming,
but it falls on deaf ears.:<PAGE>
Instead, the boss takes the opportunity to berate him.:<TAP>
\n"You know, you could stand to be a lot more productive.":<TAP>
\n"Hell, we've got people with half your experience\nthat are doing twice the work!":<TAP>

The youngest member of the team graduated from college
a mere two years ago, yet the boss misses no chance
to praise him for his work ethic.:<PAGE>
"But sir," says the junior member suddenly, "he does a lot, too.":<TAP>
\n"I have a lot to learn, but he's always patient.":<TAP>
\n"And he's willing to help with whatever I need.":<TAP>
\n\nRather than easing off at this, however, the man's boss doubles down.:<TAP>
\n"Do you see that!?" he roars. "That kind of humble attitude is\nexactly what we need around here! Am I making myself clear!?":
The man glances at his coworker and sees his mouth twist into a sneer. Gotcha!, it seems to say.:
Though the junior employee presents a humble, helpful front,\nhe actually only takes assignments that are sure to earn him praise—\nleaving the dirty, difficult work to the man.:<TAP>
\nHe knows he's the boss's favorite, and uses this fact to his full advantage.:<TAP>

And the boss thinks he's found a new lackey, so he's willing
to let his sneaky attitude slide.:<TAP>
\n\nThe man knows what they both think of him::<TAP>
\nHe is a target—a lump to be misused however they wish.:<PAGE>
Lunchtime arrives.:<TAP>
\nThe man sits in the corner break area munching\non a vending-machine pastry.:<TAP>

A stout coworker approaches with a can of coffee in hand
and gives it to the man. "Rough morning, huh?" he says.:<PAGE>
This stout man is an engineer who joined the company\nat the same time as him and now works on his team.:<TAP>

Though not close enough to call each other friends,
the man does not find his coworker's thoughtfulness unpleasant.:<TAP>

But he also knows him to be the type who tries
to please everyone and avoid making waves.:<TAP>
\n\n"Anyway, hope it all works out.":<TAP>
\nThe stout man stands there awkwardly for a moment\nbefore shuffling back to his desk.:<PAGE>
The day comes to a close.:<TAP>
\nAs the man is packing up to leave, his boss approaches.:<TAP>
\n\nHe wonders dispassionately if he is in for another scolding.:<TAP>
\nIt turns out he is; his boss immediately tears into him\nfor one thing or another.:<PAGE>
But no matter what he says, it will never resonate with the man.:<TAP>
This is just a job. It pays for food and a roof over my head. That's all.:

The man repeats this to himself as he waits for his boss
to tire himself out.:<PAGE>
Eventually, he finds himself standing on the train home.:<TAP>
\nIt's full, but not uncomfortably so, and he has room to\nscroll through his phone as he rides.:<PAGE>
As he peruses his usual gaming news sites, an advertisement catches his eye.:<TAP>

The game-development company that makes his MMO
is looking for an engineer.:<TAP>

He typically scrolls through advertisements almost unconsciously,
but this one seizes his attention immediately and refuses to let go.:<PAGE>
\nLater, the man sits down in front of his computer.:<TAP>
\nMorning.:<TAP>

He types a joking greeting in the group chat, and several people
immediately respond.:<PAGE>
morning:<TAP>
\ndid you just wake up? lol its night already:<TAP>
\nyay Levania's here!!!:<TAP>

He vaguely wonders why he feels so at home with these online
strangers who he has never met, then sets the question aside.:<TAP>
\n\nFor the next few hours, the man and his friends run raids together.:<PAGE>
But their attempts go miserably.:<TAP>
\nThe party is disjointed and out of sorts, and they end up falling apart\nat the end.:<TAP>

The man apologizes for his poor leadership, and suggests
a new strategy for their next encounter.:<TAP>

His teammates are aware the loss is not the man's fault, so they
listen to his plan and offer up occasional suggestions or tweaks.:<TAP>
\nIt is a very constructive discussion.:<PAGE>
Eventually, as always, he must return to reality.:<TAP>
\nHis friends log off one after the other, their names disappearing from the screen.:<TAP>
\n\nThen, one of them offers a parting remark.:<TAP>
\nI bet you're really helpful irl too, Levania:<TAP>

It's a compliment, the kind of casual thing people exchange
a dozen times a day.:<PAGE>
But it causes a terrible sense of guilt to rise up in the man.:<TAP>
\n\nI'm fooling them. Lying to them. I'm nothing like Levania in real life.:
\nBut if I could, I would love to be just like him...:
Though his body cries out for sleep, the man logs out of the game\nand opens his internet browser.:<TAP>

He arrives at the game developer's website and navigates
to the section on open positions.:<PAGE>
He doesn't want his online friends to know what he's like in reality.:<TAP>
\nHe doesn't want them to be disappointed.:<TAP>
\nBut if he ever wants to change that, he will need to make a greater\nchange to himself, stop drifting through life, and take some initiative.:<TAP>

Levania would know what to do and put a plan in motion right away.
In fact...:<PAGE>
After a brief moment of hesitation, he attaches his resume and sends it off.:<PAGE>
The man's smartphone lights up as he receives a notification.:<TAP>
\nHe has an email from the game company congratulating him\non passing their initial screening.:<TAP>

Though the man hardly ever shows emotion, he smiles
as he reads the email again and again.:<PAGE>
Several months later, the man finds himself entering\nthe doors of the company in his finest suit.:<TAP>

He has spent the last few months burning the candle at both ends
in order to complete his game and use it as a sample of his work.:<TAP>

They were clearly impressed, because they invited him
in for a face-to-face interview.:<PAGE>
Interviews have never been the man's forte, but he has a plan:\nHe will assume the role of Levania in his mind during the entire process.:<TAP>

As they fire question after question at him, he tries to react
as if it was just another boss battle.:<TAP>

It works better than he could have imagined,
and his answers are both positive and proactive.:<PAGE>
As the interview ends, they compliment him again on his answers\nand his game, and he leaves the building floating on air.:<PAGE>
He heads toward the train station.:<TAP>
\nThe sky above him is a cloudless, brilliant blue.:<TAP>
\n\nI think I aced that interview. I really do.:
\nIf I get the job, I'll be reborn.:
\nI can be like Levania in my real life.:
\n\nThen maybe I can be my true self around my online friends...:
\n\nAs the man sets off for home, his face is alight with hope.:<PAGE>
The next day...:<TAP>

When the man arrives to work at Dull, Inc.,
he comes across the stout coworker and junior teammate
having a serious conversation.:<TAP>
\n\nThough he doesn't wish to eavesdrop, he finds he can't help himself.:<PAGE>
Their hushed voices still carry across the empty office.:<TAP>

It seems the junior employee has made a serious error
in some of his work.:<TAP>
\nScared of how their boss will react, he tried to bury it.:<TAP>
\n\nBut he now realizes he will not be able to keep it hidden forever.:<TAP>
\nBacked into a corner, he finally decided to seek out\nthe other man for advice.:<PAGE>
After hearing the story, the stout man leans back\nin his chair and knits his fingers together.:<TAP>
\n"You have to tell the boss," he says. "Do it today.":<TAP>
\n"The longer you put it off, the worse it's going to be.":<TAP>
\n\nClearly dejected, the young man wanders off in a daze.:<PAGE>
Later that afternoon...:<TAP>
\nThe stout employee is called into the boss's office.:<TAP>

The man can't hear things clearly, but it's obvious from the tone
that their boss is chewing him out.:<PAGE>
A few words drift through the closed door, enough for the man to realize\nhis coworker is being blamed for the junior employee's mistake.:<TAP>
\n\nWhy is he taking the blame?:
\nIt wasn't even his fault.:
He glances around the room, and sees the junior employee\nand a couple of his friends looking over at the boss's office\nand snickering behind their hands.:<TAP>
\n\nI'm going to kill this guy.:
\nHe feels himself suddenly overwhelmed by terribly dark emotions.:<PAGE>
The man suddenly realizes what happened::<TAP>
\n\nThe junior teammate had pinned the mistake on his coworker.:<TAP>
\nHe did so knowing full well their boss would never question\nthe word of his favorite employee.:<PAGE>
Unable to stand it a second more, he pushes his chair back\nand begins walking toward the boss's office.:<TAP>
\n\nGrant me your courage, Levania. Just this once.:
As he nears the office, the conversation grows increasingly clear.:<PAGE>
"You two were over there whispering earlier!" says the boss.\n"Don't deny it!":<PAGE>
The man knows exactly how this will play out.:<TAP>
\nIn the end, his poor coworker will take the blame.:<TAP>
\n\nThe man readies himself and opens the door.:<TAP>
\n"I'm busy here!" cries the boss. "Can't you see that!?":<TAP>
\n\nThe man pauses, takes a deep breath, and begins to tell his side of the story.:<TAP>
\nAfter a few moments, his boss interrupts.:<PAGE>
"I see. You're in on this too.":<TAP>
\n\n"Enough. Back to your desks, both of you.":<TAP>
\n"I'll figure out what to do with you later.":<TAP>
\n\nWhen he hears this, the man feels his willpower drain out of him.:<PAGE>
Though he swore to be a stronger person like Levania,\nhe's still himself at the end of the day.:<TAP>
\nHe can't even help a single coworker.:<PAGE>
I've had enough of this company.:
\nI've had enough of me.:
\n\nI wonder if this fight would be too much even for Levania?:
\n\nThe man has no answer.:<TAP>
\nBut he knows one thing: Trying to fight a boss like his is pointless.:<PAGE>
Several weeks later...:<TAP>
\nThe man receives a letter.:<TAP>
\nIt is a formal offer of employment from the game company.:<PAGE>
The man receives a formal offer of employment from the game company.:<TAP>
\n\nThe next day, the man walks into his boss's office and hands him a letter.:<PAGE>
It is his two-week notice.:<TAP>
\nBut it is also notice that he plans to take the rest of those two weeks off\nas vacation, and will only come back for his final day of work.:<TAP>

He will still leave the job with far more vacation than he can ever use,
but he doesn't care.:<TAP>
\n\nHe simply wants to get out.:<PAGE>
His boss receives the letter coolly, showing no particular sorrow or surprise.:<PAGE>
He then informs the team of his departure during the morning huddle.:<TAP>
\n\nSoon, word spreads to the rest of the office.:<TAP>

After the meeting, the stout coworker approaches the man
and places a hand on his shoulder.
"Thanks for all your hard work—and for trying.":<PAGE>
They both know what he is referring to: After the incident with the\njunior coworker, each of the men received a reduction in salary.:<TAP>
\n\nThe fact he was punished for the fault of another upset the man greatly.:<TAP>
\nBut there was nothing to be done.:<TAP>

The stout coworker, never one to make waves, simply accepted
the pay cut without a word and continued on.:<PAGE>
That night...:<TAP>
\n\nFor the first time ever, the man and his coworker head out for a night on the town.:<PAGE>
Though his team held occasional drinking parties,\nhe had never attended one.:<TAP>
\nHe never had a reason to.:<TAP>

But this time, his falsely accused coworker had invited him,
and they both understood it would be the first
and last time such a thing ever happened.:<PAGE>
At the bar...:<TAP>
\nAlcohol works its dark magic and the man begins to open up.:<TAP>
\nHe talks about his favorite games, his next job,\nand his hopes and dreams for the future.:<TAP>
\nHe speaks of his desire to change himself.:<TAP>
\n\nHe has never laid himself bare like this; it is both liberating and terrifying.:<PAGE>
His tipsy coworker listens for a long time before finally responding,\n"I'll be so lonely with you gone.":<PAGE>
Two weeks later...:<TAP>
\nIt's the man's last day at work.:<PAGE>
He leaves his house with a spring in his step.:<TAP>

The thought of never entering Dull, Inc. again
makes the packed train feel like a vacation.:<PAGE>
All he has to do today is finish some paperwork and sign a couple of documents.:<TAP>

Once he turns in his security badge, he will walk out
the front door for the very last time.:<PAGE>
Before he reports to security, he wanders the office looking for\nthe stout coworker so he can say goodbye.:<TAP>
\n\nBut he can't find him anywhere.:<PAGE>
He asks the junior teammate if he's seen him and the man responds,\n"That guy? How should I know?":<TAP>
\nYet again, he feels his blood begin to run cold as rage overwhelms him.:<PAGE>
Perhaps his coworker called in sick.\nPerhaps he had a planned day off.:<TAP>
\nWith no other choice, the man finishes his paperwork and leaves.:<PAGE>
He then makes his way to the station.:<TAP>
\nHe stands at the center of the platform, waiting for his train to arrive.:<TAP>
\nIt's early, and the station is relatively empty.:<PAGE>
Tomorrow, he will begin a new life at a new company.:<TAP>
\nHe will never have to set foot in this station again.:<TAP>
\nIt is another in a series of goodbyes.:<TAP>
\n\nA momentary feeling of loneliness quickly transforms into one of excitement.:<PAGE>
Starting tomorrow, I'll be reborn in a new world—\none where no one knows me.:
\nI'll be strong and reliable, just like Levania.:
\n\nThe light of hope shines brightly on the man's heart.:<PAGE>
A voice echoes through the station announcing the arrival of the next train.:<PAGE>
Suddenly, something collides with the man from behind.:<TAP>
\nHe stumbles forward and goes flying onto the tracks.:<PAGE>
What happened?:
\nWhere are my glasses?:
\nOh god, I need to get back!:
But the man finds himself frozen in confusion and fear.:<TAP>
\nA lone figure looks down on him from the platform.:<TAP>
\nIt is muttering something.:<TAP>
\n\n"With you gone...":<PAGE>
The man's head snaps up.:<TAP>
\n\nStanding before him was the coworker the man had tried to protect.:<PAGE>
"With you gone...":<TAP>
\n"I'll be the one they bully!":
"I can't stand that!":
\n"I can't stand the thought of you being happier than me!":
"But with you gone—":<PAGE>
The shrill sound of a train whistle drowns out the rest of the thought.:<PAGE>
All sound stops.:<TAP>
\n\nIn a silent vortex of darkness, a few thoughts swirl::<PAGE>
I don't want to die. I want to keep living.:
\n\nDreams... Hope...:
\n\nRe...born...:
\n\nI...am...:
"Last night's dream was special, Mommy. I was a princess!":<TAP>
\n\nHer mother sets a potato down and turns to stare at her daughter.:<TAP>
\nHer eyes seem to bore holes in her.:<TAP>
\n"I told you to knock off that fool talk. You're a Commoner,\nnot a Noble—and you never will be.":<PAGE>
"Is this dress too garish?":<TAP>
\nMy sister drew up her shoulders as she spoke,\ngrasping the hem of her beautiful white dress.:<TAP>

It was generously decorated in layer upon layer of delicate lace,
with small diamonds sparkling here and there.
I let out a small sigh as I stared at her.:<PAGE>
"You look lovely, my sister. And well you should,\nfor today is certain to be the finest day of your life.":<TAP>

My sister nodded, satisfied, and turned this way and that
to better admire her reflection in the mirror.:<PAGE>
We were twins, both princesses in the land we called home.:<TAP>
\nThough we shared a visage, my sister was bright, sociable,\nsmart, and popular. She was the very image of perfection.:<TAP>

Whereas I was shy, dull, not at all clever, I didn't have
many friends... I was wholly unremarkable.:<PAGE>
This day, my sister was setting off on a journey\nto be wed to a foreign prince.:<TAP>
\nIt would be a grand ceremony on a scale I had never seen.:<TAP>

Our country and the prince's had long been at war, you see,
but this wedding would unite our families and finally
bring an end to the seemingly eternal conflict.:<TAP>
\n\nIt had all been set in motion by our mother—the queen.:<PAGE>
The day was clear, and a warm sun sat high in the sky.:<TAP>
\nBefore stepping into the jewel-studded carriage, my sister turned\nto take a final look at the castle where she was born and raised.:<TAP>

"I will birth a son and raise the next king, Mother,"
she said with pride. "So wait and stay safe until then."
:<TAP>
\n\nWith these words, she entered her carriage.:<PAGE>
Moments later, the carriage set off with great pomp.\nIt would be several days before she crossed the border,\nso she settled in for a long ride.:<TAP>
\nIt sparkled in the sunlight, as though lighting the path ahead.:<PAGE>
What a perfect beauty!:<TAP>
What a perfect wedding!:<TAP>
What a perfect prince!:<TAP>
\nI was so proud of my sister; seemingly nothing was beyond her reach,\nand she had accomplished everything she ever set out to do in life.:<TAP>

I knew her future would be bright, with nothing but great things
waiting for her.:<TAP>
\nThat's how her life always was, after all.:<TAP>
\n\nI waved and waved until the carriage vanished from view.:<PAGE>
The girl slowly opens her eyes.:<TAP>
\nThen closes them.:<TAP>

She had been dreaming again.
In her dream, she was a princess.:<TAP>
\nShe is disappointed that sleep has fled;\nshe wanted to see more.:<TAP>

For even though she wasn't the lead princess
in this particular dream, it was still much nicer
than her usual nightmares.:<PAGE>
Defeated, she opens her eyes, gazes for a moment at the foul,\ngrime-covered ceiling above, and rises from her shabby bed.:<TAP>
\nToday, she will study hard, help however she can,\nand spend another day being a very good girl.:<PAGE>
"Good morning, Mommy. Do you wanna hear about my dream?":<TAP>

"Dreams are nonsense, girl, and you've no time for such foolery.
Now eat your breakfast and get to school.":<TAP>

On the table is a bowl of thin gruel and a heel of bread.
The girl sits on a rickety chair and pulls the food close.:<PAGE>
The bread is hard enough to shatter teeth.:<TAP>
But it's all Commoners like them can afford, so she's quite used to it.:<PAGE>
"Last night's dream was special, Mommy. I was a princess!":<TAP>
\n\nHer mother sets a potato down and turns to stare at her daughter.:<TAP>
\nHer eyes seem to bore holes in her.:<TAP>
\n"I told you to knock off that fool talk. You're a Commoner,\nnot a Noble—and you never will be.":<PAGE>
The girl is well aware of this.:<TAP>
\nEven the youngest child knows of the country's strict class system.:<TAP>
\nHere, the disparity between Nobles and Commoners is great indeed.:<TAP>
\nThe Commoners have long been discontent with their lot in life,\nand the Nobles worry increasingly about social unrest.:<TAP>

But the girl had no wish to argue politics—she simply
wanted to make conversation with her mother.:<TAP>
\nStung, she drops her eyes and quickly finishes her breakfast.:<TAP>
\n\n"I'm going now, Mommy.":<TAP>
\nThe girl hurriedly gets dressed, gathers her things,\nand leaves the house for school.:<PAGE>
Winter. A most rainy season.:<TAP>
\nThough the rain has stopped, puddles still dot the road.:<TAP>
\nShe stands at one and looks at her face reflected in the water.:<TAP>
\n\nShe does not look like her mother.:<TAP>
\nNor does she look at all like her father.:<PAGE>
She senses she is not much loved by either.:<TAP>
\nAnd she believes her face to be the reason.:<TAP>
\nSuddenly angry, she stamps on the face in the puddle\nand rushes off to school.:<TAP>
\n\nShe is determined to study hard and win her parents' praise.:<PAGE>
The roses were finally blooming.:<TAP>
\nFrom my window, I saw the bright red flowers stretching out\nas far as the eye could see.:<TAP>

The buds had been firmly shut for so long, but warm weather
had finally come yesterday to loosen winter's icy hold.:<TAP>

But as magnificent as the flower garden was,
I had grown so very weary of looking at it.:<TAP>
\nI had been staring at it since the day I arrived in this country.:<TAP>
\n...Since the day they locked me in this room.:<PAGE>
To pass the time, I started counting the roses.\nWhen I reached the 48th rose, I spotted the prince walking\nalongside his young and beautiful princess.:<TAP>
\n\nI knew the princess well.:<TAP>
\nShe was my twin, after all.:<PAGE>
A group of Nobles followed them, chattering merrily away.:<TAP>
\nThe castle, a fun and lively place for most inhabitants,\nhosted a tea party in the garden at this time every week.:<TAP>

Delighted peels of laughter soon intermingled
with the clinking of porcelain.:<TAP>
\nI quietly slipped out of view and listened in.:<PAGE>
"You have been beaming with happiness every day\nsince the wedding, Your Highness.":<TAP>
\n"People all across the land speak of the princess's beauty!":<PAGE>
It was true: The marriage of a prince from the west and my sister\nfrom the east was on the lips of people in both countries.:<TAP>
\nOf greatest concern was when she might bear him a child.:<TAP>

That was the reason I am here; the reason I was summoned
to this place soon after the wedding was complete.:<TAP>
\nBecause I...:<TAP>
\nI am to birth the prince's child in place of my sister.:<PAGE>
"Oh, I can hardly wait! Will it be a prince or princess?"\n"No matter what, I'm certain it will be adorable.":<TAP>
\n"I've heard His Majesty the King has already prepared\nseveral midwives for the happy day.":<PAGE>
It didn't take long for the prince and his court to realize\nhis new bride was barren. So I was smuggled into the\ncountry in the dead of night.:<TAP>
\nNo one could be allowed to know of my existence.:<TAP>
\n\nOf course, I would do anything for my sister. Anything.:
\n\n...I just thought she might come see me at some point.:<PAGE>
"The sun is beginning to set.":<TAP>

\nIf he forced him to run further, it might cause serious harm.:<PAGE>
The man quickly scans the area.:<TAP>
\n\nThe tunnel is massive, stretching on without end in both directions.:<TAP>

\n\nAfter a brief search, he locates a door in the wall.:<TAP>
\nIt is half-buried in debris, but when the man peers inside,\nhe finds a small storage room behind it.:<PAGE>
Slumbering within are battered lanterns, picks, and shovels.:<TAP>
\nIt is a storage place for tools used to maintain the tunnel.:<TAP>

Thinking it the perfect spot to lie low,
the man brings his young charge inside.:<PAGE>
"This is all because I took command," says the prince sadly.:<TAP>
\nWith his ragged breaths now steadied, he is able to turn\na critical eye upon his earlier actions.:<TAP>

As his kingdom commits to a cycle of endless war,
soldiers and citizens alike are growing increasingly weary.:<TAP>
\nThe prince chose to take on the burden of command\nso he might be able to save them all.:<TAP>
\nBut in the end, things did not transpire as he wanted.:<PAGE>
He never considered having to place the lives\nof his own soldiers on the scales.:<TAP>
\nBut he now sees that what he thought of as kindness\nhad instead brought death and pain to multitudes.:<TAP>
\n\nThe man stares at the boy and considers his words.:<PAGE>

\nAs the words leave his mouth, they feel strange. Off.:<TAP>
\n\nHe cannot grasp the intention behind what he said.:<TAP>

\n\nThe boy stares at the man blankly.:<PAGE>
They wait that way for a bit, alone in the darkness.:<TAP>
\nBut then, a small glimmer of brightness returns to his face.:<TAP>

With an awkward, unpracticed smile, the boy thanks the man
for saving his life during the recent battle.:<TAP>

"If I am ever in danger again," he says,
"maybe you can help me out.":<TAP>
\nHis words come with a hint of jest, but also a touch of joy.:<PAGE>
The clockwork man continues his conversation with the prince,\nbut as they do so, the boy's coughs come more frequently.:<TAP>
\n\nHe eventually produces a medicine bottle from his pocket.:<TAP>
\nThe man surmises it is used to suppress the cough.:<TAP>
\nBut the bottle is empty.:<PAGE>
A pained look moves across the prince's face,\none that he tries and fails to hide.:<TAP>

\n\n"This is a lesson my father taught me again and again.":<TAP>

He had not coughed once at the base because the medicine
was able to disguise his symptoms. But now...:<PAGE>
"That is why what you see here must remain a secret.":<TAP>
\nHis speech complete, the boy raises a pinky finger\nand extends it to the clockwork man.:<TAP>
\n\nThe man's database tells him this is a human ritual of promise.:<TAP>

Though he intertwines his finger with the prince's,
the action makes him somehow uneasy.:<PAGE>
The man suddenly hears the distant sound of footsteps.:<TAP>
\nHe concentrates his aural apparatus on the noise.:<TAP>
\nEnemy soldiers, most likely. He estimates a dozen or so.:<TAP>
\n\nHe fixes his eyes on the gap in the door, half-buried in rubble.:<PAGE>
A thin, wavering line of light passes through it.:<TAP>
\n\nHe will never outrun the men with the sickly prince in tow.:<TAP>
\n\nSo both man and prince still their breaths, stay put, and wait.:<PAGE>
The man places his hand over the boy's mouth\nso he will not give them away.:<TAP>
\n\nThe light through the door grows brighter, then brighter still.:<PAGE>
*cough*:<TAP>
\n\nThe prince's body betrays them both.:<PAGE>
They sit in the darkened room.:<TAP>
\nThe man presses a hand against the prince's mouth,\nto still his breathing.:<TAP>
\n\nMen—most likely enemy soldiers—are approaching their position.:<TAP>

But as they wait for them to pass, the prince's cough
rips through the silence.:<PAGE>
"Here!" yells a soldier. "They're here!":<TAP>

The room surrounded, the man knows he has no choice but to

\n\nBut he does not fire.:<PAGE>

But as he approaches the soldiers, the general raises a hand
and his men point their swords at him.:<PAGE>
The prince stops moving and confusion spreads across his face.:<TAP>
\nThis sight causes the general to snicker.:<TAP>
\n\nHe then explains a shocking truth::<PAGE>
A plot has been unfolding behind the scenes.:<TAP>
\nThe prince is to be murdered, and his death blamed on the war.:<TAP>

The plan was set in motion by his younger brother,
who sought to eliminate his competition for the throne.:<TAP>

During the previous battle, they had set their units in inferior
positions in order to tilt the battle in favor of the enemy.

chaos as cover to eliminate the prince.:<TAP>

"This can't be happening..." murmurs the prince.:<TAP>
\nThe general grins wide.:<TAP>

Suddenly, the clockwork man turns to the general,
who immediately barks an order::<TAP>
\n\n"You there! Machine! Stand down at once!":<PAGE>
The man is a mechanical soldier manufactured by the kingdom.:<TAP>
\nHe is programmed to follow any order from a superior officer.:<TAP>

He watches dispassionately as the general approaches the boy

"You're a useless worm—an unthinking coward who put all of us

Tears begin to spill down the prince's cheeks,
but he does not deny the truth of these words.:<TAP>

His piece said, the general raises his sword

The clockwork man cannot accept what he is seeing.:<TAP>
\n\nI must protect the prince.:
\nI must stop the general.:
\nI must reach for my gun.:
\n\nBut because of the general's orders, he can do nothing.:<TAP>

Instead, in the face of the prince's last moments,

He sees how the prince desperately issued commands\nin an attempt to keep his soldiers safe.:<TAP>
\nHe sees how the prince showed weakness—and trusted him.:<TAP>
\n\nSuddenly, his records find a phrase the prince said moments before::<TAP>
\n\nIf I am ever in danger again...:

The man draws iron, his hand fast as blue blazes,

\nThe general's men, caught off-guard, fall one after the other.:<PAGE>
\n\nThe prince had said the line in passing jest::<TAP>
\nIf I am ever in danger again, maybe you can help me out.:

But the clockwork man chooses to take these words as royal orders

of a senior military officer.:<PAGE>
The wounded general snarls and draws his own weapon.:<TAP>

The general begins to plead for his life, but it means nothing

Though he did not speak his feelings aloud, the man understands

A moment later, more footsteps ring out.:<TAP>

In the middle of a wasteland where the wind blows dry\nstands a kingdom surrounded by walls.:<TAP>
\nThe contours of an enormous castle waver as the sun sets behind it.:<TAP>
\n\nThe clockwork man and the prince approach the kingdom with a sigh.:<TAP>
\nThey are home.:<PAGE>
They stand before a thick metal door at the castle gate\nthat leads to the town beyond.:<TAP>
\nA guard sees the two and approaches.:<TAP>

The guards respectfully place the prince

\nBut as he watches the prince go, the clockwork man\nis presented with a false warrant for his alleged crimes.:<PAGE>
The first charge: Abandoning his post.\nThe second charge: Betraying his unit.\nThe third charge: Murder of a superior officer.:<TAP>
\nThe man did what he did to save the life of the prince.:<TAP>

And even if they were completely true,
he still believes what he did was right.:<PAGE>
The clockwork man is taken to a laboratory.:<TAP>

A researcher orders him into a mechanical chair

\n\nHis "treatment" will be a complete memory wipe.:<PAGE>
The man's consciousness drifts in darkness.:<TAP>
\nIt is a strange sensation, almost like floating.:<TAP>
\n\nThis is his memory space.:<TAP>
\n\nIn the darkness, images begin to form.:<TAP>
\nHe sees men blasted to bits by his own steel.:<PAGE>
Memories of war.:<TAP>
\nThe face of every man he's ever killed is recorded here.:<TAP>
\n\nNext, he sees a conversation he had with the general.:<TAP>
\nHe is being ordered to protect the prince at all cost.:<TAP>
\n\nImages appear. Images flicker. Images disappear.:<TAP>

\nHe sees his pained expression as he spoke of his weakness.:<TAP>
\nHe sees him shed tears at hearing the truth behind the war.:<TAP>
\n\n"That is why what you see here must remain a secret.":<TAP>
\nHe sees the secret promise and ritual they shared.:<TAP>
\n\nCompared to his other memories, these almost seem to...glow.:<PAGE>
Suddenly, a sound—a single, insistent buzz.:<TAP>
\n\nHis memories of the prince begin to fade.:<PAGE>
He cannot stop it; they vanish one after the other.:<TAP>
\n\nHe should not be bothered by this.:<TAP>
\nAfter all, he is a mechanical soldier designed for war.:<TAP>
\n\nThe memory-reset program whirs inside him.:<TAP>

He reaches out to them with his mind.:<TAP>
\nBut he will never find them.:<TAP>
\n\nThe deletion accelerates. The buzzing grows louder.:<TAP>
\n\nA pained groan slips from his lips.:<TAP>
\nWhat was the meaning behind his own feelings?\nWhy did he resist the procedure?:<PAGE>
The man's eyes spring open.:<TAP>
\n\nHe does not know why he is in the laboratory.:<TAP>
\nHe knows only that he is a mechanical soldier created for war.:<TAP>
\n\nOne researcher looks at the results and shakes his head.:<TAP>

"Looks like there was an error in the reset process.
You're going to be discarded.":<PAGE>
After being informed of his fate, the man is taken away\nand placed in an underground storehouse.:<TAP>
\n\nHis only companion is the hiss of steam escaping from pipes.:<TAP>
\nMixed in among similarly discarded scraps of junk,\nthe man attempts to sleep.:<PAGE>
But an alien sensation in his chest prevents it.:<TAP>

Even after he searches all parts of his memory,
he cannot locate the cause.:<TAP>
\n\nHe realizes that thinking about it will accomplish nothing.:<TAP>
\nAll he can do is wait as he slowly rots away.:<PAGE>
There is someone I must see.:
\n\nWhat comes to mind at the very end is nonsense.:<TAP>

A pale and bloody arm flails in the air.:<TAP>

\n\nIt longs for escape. Yearns for it.:<TAP>
\nBut if it is only going to break in the end,\nwhat is the purpose of obtaining it?:<TAP>
\n\n<align=right>—A Poem of Wayward Imprisonment:<PAGE>
The woman's bloody hand holds a knife.:<TAP>
\n\nHer finger notes the light sensation of blade against bone.:<TAP>
\nIt is so very familiar.:<TAP>
\nThis feeling—one honed to a science while taking countless lives—\nis the sensation of death.:<TAP>
\nHer life has been spent with a blade in her hands,\nand she does not intend to fail now.:<TAP>

She puts pressure on her middle and ring fingers,
while the rest curl tightly around the hilt.:<TAP>
\nAlmost as if they are drawing in the death she senses.:<TAP>
\nThe bones will separate. The head will fall. The—:<PAGE>
"Hang on.":<TAP>
\nWoman and blade alike pause at the voice.:<TAP>
\nThe voice, high in tone like a ringing bell, continued.:<TAP>

"Leave the head. With mackerel, you don't take the head off
until you're ready to remove the rest of the guts.":<PAGE>
The woman with the knife replies with a question::<TAP>
\n"And what of the bones?":<TAP>
\n"It's okay to cut those, but don't separate it entirely.":<TAP>
\n"Cooking is very different from killing," muses the woman.:<TAP>
\n"Yeah, I suppose it would be," replies the speaker.:<TAP>
\nThey giggle slightly while imparting this bit of wisdom.:<PAGE>
The setting sun floods the room with persimmon light.:<TAP>
\nIt is a small interval between the sweltering summer\nand the coolness of autumn.:<TAP>
\nThe sun flees the world earlier each day.:<TAP>

And as the day takes its leave, night stretches out
greedy fingers to reclaim what was stolen in the dawn.:<PAGE>
The speaker continues. "Once you've taken out the innards,\nyou can move on to the bloodline.":<TAP>
\n"Bloodline?":<TAP>
\nThe woman stands, knife in hand, and awaits an answer.:<TAP>
\nShe typically wielded her blade on a battlefield, not in a kitchen,\nand is unable to find a comfortable grip on the paring knife.:<TAP>
\n\n"Apparently it's muscle. See the dark red parts there?":<TAP>
\n"The bloodline... An apt name.":<TAP>
\nA girl of about sixteen—the speaker—peers over the shoulder\nof the woman with the knife and smiles, her long hair fluttering.:<PAGE>
"Does my cooking amuse you?" asks the woman.:<TAP>
\nShe stares at the cooking board as she says it,\nbut her annoyance is clear.:<TAP>
\n"Heh heh. It is cute to see someone who's so cool in a fight\nhave trouble with a mackerel.":
\n\nThe girl grins as she says this, lighting up the room.:<TAP>
\nAshamed, the woman looks away.:<TAP>
\nThis only serves to delight the girl all the more.:<PAGE>
"I'm obviously no expert," says the woman. "I did not grow up doing such things.":<TAP>
\n"Yeah, well, I'd never done it either until that day.":<TAP>
\n\nThe woman knows this well.:<TAP>
\nWith nothing to say in return, she falls to silence.:<PAGE>
That day.:
\nThe two of them know exactly what this means.:<TAP>

Five years ago. Early summer.
<WAIT=010>Heavy rain blanketed the sky.:<TAP>
\nIt was the day the assassin met the girl—her target.:<TAP>
\nShe was going to take her life as she had countless others.:<TAP>

But the woman did not kill her.\n<WAIT=010>Call it a whim.:<TAP>

\n\nTheirs is a relationship forged in checkered fate.:<TAP>
\nThey had both cast aside their own lives to form this new one,\nwhere each day stretches out in quiet solitude.:<PAGE>
In the distance, a cricket begins to stir.:<TAP>
\n\n"Hey, I'm sorry," says the girl. "I shouldn't have teased you.":<TAP>
\n"You're the only one who actually works around here anyway,\nso thank you. I really appreciate it.":
\nThe woman turns to look over her shoulder at her young companion.:<TAP>

"Flattery will get you nowhere..."
<WAIT=010>Turning away once more, she utters a weak protest.:<TAP>
\nBut the girl knows this action is an admittance of defeat,\nand her radiant smile lights up anew.:<PAGE>
"Enough foolishness. Tell me what to do with this creature.":<TAP>
\n"Well, you took the bloodline out, so now you have to wash it.":<TAP>

The woman nods, picks the fish up off the cutting board,
and dips it into a pail of cool water.:<TAP>
\n\nBlood seeps out of the mackerel, staining the water a faint red.:<PAGE>
The flower reaches to the heavens above,\ngazing at the brilliant sun and indulging in fantasy.:<TAP>
\nIt will do so until the time comes that it blackens and withers,\nfinally learning that it will never reach the sky.:<TAP>
\n\nPetals unfurl. Grasping. Delicate fingers.:<TAP>
\n\nPeople fear such honest desire.:<TAP>
\nWe are scared to even desire at all.:<TAP>
\n\n<align=right>—A Poem of Forgotten Imprisonment:<PAGE>
The woman looks at the fillet in her hand.:<TAP>
\n"Making cuts and inserting salt seems like a method of torture.":<TAP>

There are no deep feelings or regrets behind the words;
she says them as simply as someone passing the time of day.:<TAP>
\nThe girl, however, is taken aback.:<TAP>
\n"Uh... Well, sure? But mackerel's a bluefish, so you have to get the\nsmell out...":<PAGE>
She is attempting to teach the woman a dish called mackerel miso.:<TAP>
\nIt is not a particularly difficult dish to make,\nand perfect for teaching someone how to handle fish.:<TAP>
\nThis is why the girl selected it.:<TAP>

"Now we let it rest, correct?"
<WAIT=010>She confirms each step of the process with the girl.:<TAP>
\nThey had divided responsibilities since they began living together.:<TAP>
\nThe woman has learned well her young charge's skill in the kitchen.:<PAGE>
"Yep! Once the salt gets in there, it'll draw out the moisture.":<TAP>
\nBut the girl has not always been skilled at cooking.:<TAP>
\nIt was a task she threw herself into after meeting the woman,\nand her first few years were littered with failed attempts.:<TAP>
\n\n"Then removing the moisture also takes away the smell?":<TAP>
\n"You got it! Oh, and we're also going to parboil it,\nso might as well get the water ready in the meantime.":<PAGE>
The girl pauses and knits her fingers together, looking at the woman shyly.:<TAP>
\n"So, um...have you ever actually done that?":
\nThe woman's earlier comment is clearly still weighing on her.:<TAP>
\n\n"Torture, you mean? Hmm, not really.":<TAP>
\n"Oh! Oh. Well, um... That's good?":<TAP>
\n"Killing was my job.":<TAP>
\n"Torture would be the domain of another.":<PAGE>
The conversation takes the girl back once more to that day.:<TAP>
\nShe remembers how the woman saved her life by\ntaking out an entire battalion of samurai.:<TAP>

Afterward, the young girl somehow managed to drag
her unconscious savior out of the castle.:<TAP>
\nShe grabbed all the gold coin she could carry from her house,\nand hurried in search of a doctor.:<PAGE>
Soaked from heavy rain and the woman's blood, her legs threatening to\nsnap under her burden, she screamed for help until her throat was raw.:<TAP>

As the woman lay bleeding on a tatami mat,
she had said four words to the girl::<TAP>
\n"Live as you please.":<TAP>
\nNo one had ever said such a thing to her.:<TAP>
\nShe did not even know it was an option.:<TAP>
\nThat was why she sought so desperately to save the woman:\nbecause she wanted to.:
But what the girl knows of the woman is only what she saw on that day,\nand on the days since.:<TAP>
\n\nHow much pain and hardship had she truly experienced?:<TAP>
\nThe girl had felt a sudden awareness of the distance between them.:<PAGE>
A flock of birds flies off into the late summer sunset.:<TAP>
\nDark shadows bleed across the kitchen like spilled ink.:<TAP>
\n\n"Sorry," says the girl. "That was a weird question.":<TAP>
\n"I probably shouldn't ask about... You know. That stuff.":<TAP>
\nThe woman does not think fondly of her past.\n<WAIT=010>The girl is very aware of this.:<TAP>
\n\nBut this night, it does not seem to bother her overmuch.:<TAP>
\n"It's all right. I don't mind the question.":<PAGE>
The girl hesitates.:<TAP>
\n"Yeah, but...":<TAP>

She does not like being placated.
<WAIT=010>If someone wants to tell her no, it's far better
for them to simply do so instead of pretending.:<TAP>

But the woman is smiling, and the girl slowly realizes
she actually does mean it after all.:<TAP>
\n"I may hide my past, but that doesn't make it go away.":<TAP>
\nThe girl listens intently.:<TAP>
\n"Besides, the two of us have few secrets from each other\nat this point, wouldn't you say?":<TAP>
\nThe woman's eyes form a pair of crescent moons as she smiles.:<PAGE>
Her answer—and her smile—fill the hole in the girl's heart.:<TAP>
\n"Thanks.":<TAP>
\n"Of course.":<TAP>
\nSatisfied, the woman turns away.\nThe girl stares at her back and mutters::<TAP>
\n\n"...You're too good at that.":<PAGE>
Some say a flower is most beautiful when its petals begin to fall.:<TAP>
\nYet death is inevitable, and holds no value in itself.:<TAP>
\n\nWe reach out our hands, seeking beauty.:<TAP>
\nBut obtaining it can be a difficult thing,\nand the quest often shows us our limits.:<TAP>
\nIt is naught but delusion to recall failures to reach beauty as having\nbeen beautiful themselves.:<TAP>
\n\nThus does humanity continue to err in order to console itself.:<TAP>
\n\n—<align=right>A Poem of Melded Imprisonment:<PAGE>
As the sun sinks below the horizon,\nhints of night begin to draw over the land.:<TAP>
\nMore crickets strike up a chorus in anticipation of the moon.:<TAP>
\nSoon, another sound joins them in harmony.:<TAP>
\n\nThe girl cocks her head as she stirs the pot.:<TAP>
\n"Those are giant katydids.":<PAGE>
"You certainly know this land," replies the woman.:<TAP>
\nShe is busy rubbing the sliced skin of the mackerel to remove the oil.:<TAP>
\n\n"Yeah, I just read about them in a book.":<TAP>
\n"Ah, yes. You've acquired quite a collection of used books.":<TAP>
\nThe two of them live near a forest that is some distance from the\nclosest town.:<TAP>
\nBoth due to lack of other diversions, and because of her own passion\nfor reading, the girl was often seen passing the time with book in hand.:<PAGE>
"Just doing some studying.\nI've been thinking it's about time I looked for work.":<TAP>
\nThe girl smiles brightly.:<TAP>
\n"Hmm. That's how it usually goes, is it?":<TAP>
\n\nThere is a tinge of sadness to the woman's response.:<TAP>
\nThe woman had been "working" from before the age the girl is now.:<TAP>
\nShe killed her first man when she was not even ten.:<TAP>

"Okay, I think the mackerel should be ready now.":<TAP>
\nThe girl pulls her ladle from the pot,\nwhich is bubbling merrily away.:<TAP>
\nThe woman stands beside her, holding a towel.:<TAP>
\n"Go ahead and put it in there and let's give it a boil.":<TAP>
\n"Got it.":<TAP>
\nThe woman's voice has a tinge of excitement, which causes the girl\nto smile.:<PAGE>
Wielding a large pair of cooking chopsticks even more uncomfortably\nthan she did the knife, she manages to transfer the fillet to the pot.:<TAP>
\n\n"Make sure to put the skin face-up.":<TAP>
\n"Like this?":<TAP>
\n"Yep! Now throw some ginger in there and put the lid on.":<TAP>
\n\nThe woman follows the girl's instructions with awkward movements.:<TAP>
\nBut the dexterity of her fingers is cause for wonder.:<TAP>

"So how is work, anyway?":<TAP>
\nThe girl watches the pot while she asks the question.:<TAP>
\n"Much easier than my old job. I may end up losing my edge.":<TAP>
\nThe woman flexes her hands as she speaks.:<TAP>

\nShe is a master of weapons large and small, and her technique\nand experience made her a formidable foe.:<PAGE>
And now, she uses those skills to make her living.:<TAP>
\nShe takes on occasional work as a bodyguard,\nor teaches young royals in the way of the sword.:<TAP>
\n\nAt times, she faces down death once again.:<TAP>
\nIt makes her feel that she is still the same killer she always was,\nbut in these times in which they live, it is difficult to avoid.:<TAP>
\nAnd compared to her past, at least, working as a mercenary is much\nless taxing.:<TAP>

Theirs is an era of turbulence and upheaval where people rarely
stay put for long, yet they had managed to build a home.:<PAGE>
"I'm glad it's going well," says the girl.:<TAP>
\nThe girl smiles at the woman.:<TAP>
\n"So when you say you're going to look for work," begins the woman,\n"is it because...":<TAP>

\nBut while they expected the mutant target,\nthe did not expect it to appear with such speed.:

The mutant fell from the sky like a meteorite, crushing one of the
girls on contact. Before the group could even register this fact,
it had felled another of their number.:<TAP>
\n\nThe girls' blood rained down across the ruined city.:<TAP>
\nThe mutant's empty eyes towered above them.:<PAGE>
Which brings us to the present.:<TAP>
\nWhile the group successfully reorganized their formation,\nthe battle has not yet turned in their favor.:<TAP>
\n\nDodging the mutant's constant blows, the girls deliver their own.:<TAP>
\nBut their blades cannot pierce its thick skin.:<TAP>

Their movements begin to slow, exhaustion taking hold
as attack after attack comes up empty.:<TAP>
\nBut then, the sound of an explosion from behind the target::<TAP>
\nThe unmistakable percussion of a sniper rifle.:<PAGE>
A large bullet pierces the mutant's neck,\ncausing the massive figure to stagger.:<TAP>
\n\nBut it quickly recovers.:<TAP>
\nThe bullet's path becomes another scar. :<TAP>
\nAs the girl loads another bullet in the chamber,\nthe mutant makes a slow turn to face her.:<TAP>
\n\n...Which is exactly what she wants.:<PAGE>
The human body is covered with soft muscle and skin\nthat stretches and contracts as it moves.:<TAP>

And the larger a body is, the more that muscle and skin
is forced to move and contract—and to stretch thin.:<TAP>
\nThe scars on the mutant's skin are places that have\nbeen damaged from this constant stretching.:<TAP>
\n\nIt was the sword-wielder who first realized this.:<TAP>
\n\nAs the mutant turns, a scar tears open on its lower back.:<TAP>
\nAnd while its attention is focused elsewhere, the sword-wielder\nleaps high in the air and slams her weapon through the opening.:<PAGE>
The mutant lets out a cry as it crumbles to the ground.:<TAP>
\nThe girl continues running up its back, dragging her blade\nbehind her to create a massive canyon of flesh and bone.:<TAP>
\nBlood fountains from the wound, painting her red.:<TAP>
\n\nThe mutant falls face first onto the ground.:<TAP>
\nThe earth shakes. Dust flies.:<TAP>
\nThe moment it falls, the remaining girls\nfocus their attack on the head.:<TAP>
\n\nSpecifically the neck, where the bullet has created a new scar.:<TAP>
\nThe sniper fires again, creating a new furrow in the creature.:<TAP>
\nThe rest of the group attacks this new opening with relish.:<PAGE>
The mutant shivers. It howls. Its fingers contract, convulse...\nand then, finally, it moves no more.:<TAP>

Watching from a distance, the sniper releases her grip on her
rifle and lets out her breath.:<TAP>

The purpose of holding her breath is to steady her aim.
It is only natural to exhale after the shot.
But this time, it almost sounds like a sigh of relief.:<TAP>
\n\nShe shoulders her rifle and prepares to rejoin the group.:<TAP>
\nBut before she can move, a sound erupts behind her.:<PAGE>
It is the thirteenth target.:<TAP>
\nIt had emerged from the ruins close to the isolated sniper,\nand now tears out her windpipe.:<TAP>
\n\nBlood mists across the air. :<TAP>
\nCrimson spreads over the ground.:<PAGE>
\nA ragged breath escapes from her ripped throat.:<TAP>
\nIn her dimming consciousness, the girl looks at her palm.:<TAP>
\n\nAll she finds is her bloody, lifeless hand.:<PAGE>
And so, the thirteenth target falls.:<TAP>
\n\nWith the operation complete, the driverless vehicle returns.:<TAP>
\nThe armored machine carries the group back to the place\nwhere they first woke up.:<TAP>

It is dark in the vehicle, and featureless save for
slots to store weapons and handrails along the sides.:<TAP>
\nIt is the typical construction for a vehicle that carries weapons.:<PAGE>
The automobile motors across the wilderness.:<TAP>
\nThe girls sit on the floor inside.:<TAP>
\nA full half of them do not make the return trip.:<TAP>
\n\nThe air is filled with the scent of metal and oppressive silence.:<TAP>
\nThe weapons on the wall still drip with blood.:<TAP>
\nOne of the girls stares at them for no reason in particular.:<PAGE>
She sees her own sword, as well as a number of weapons\nthat no longer have anyone to wield them.:<TAP>
\nSome of the slots contain nothing at all,\ntheir weapons having been too damaged to recover.:<TAP>

In particular, many guns are missing, and the largest such gap is one
that used to hold a sniper rifle.:<TAP>
\n\nA thought crosses the girl's mind as she stares at the space::<TAP>
\nThere is a hole that will never be filled.:
The journey continues. No one speaks.:<TAP>
\nDespite the silence, they still hear nothing from outside the vehicle.:<TAP>
\n\nFinally, the girl stops staring at the weapons and closes her eyes.:<TAP>
\nShe leans back and waits for time to pass.:<TAP>

She knows the return trip is the same distance as the first,
but it seems to be taking much, much longer.:<TAP>
\n\nIt feels like she will be in this vehicle forever.:<PAGE>
Some time later...:<TAP>
\n\nThe vehicle finally comes to a stop.:<TAP>
\n\nIts doors open automatically.:<TAP>
\nLight pours inside.:<PAGE>
The girls file out.:<TAP>
\nSome walk slowly, nursing wounds.:<TAP>
\nSome walk slowly, nursing exhaustion.:<TAP>

But the girl who had her eyes closed does not move; instead,
she remains in the vehicle and listens to the footsteps of
her companions slowly fade into the distance.:<TAP>

Once that sound is no more, she opens her eyes,
forces herself to her feet, and steps out.:<PAGE>
The moment she touches ground, the sound of the large doors closing begins.:<TAP>
\n\nOn a whim, she turns back to look.:<TAP>
\nShe sees the wall of weapons slowly disappear.:<TAP>
\nThe engine begins to hum.:<TAP>

The girl stands in place, completely alone,
until the vehicle drives off.:<PAGE>
When the girls return to their dark room,\nthey see cold white letters on a blue screen.:<TAP>
\n"WELL DONE.":<TAP>
\n\n"THERE ARE FEWER CASUALTIES THAN ESTIMATED.":<TAP>
\nThe words of praise flicker for a moment before vanishing.:<PAGE>
A rundown of their next operation suddenly\nsprings to life on the screen.:<TAP>

Though the objective and plan remain the same, the scale this time
will be larger, including the number of targets.:<TAP>
\nWhich means their numbers will need to be replenished.:<TAP>
\n\nThe girls stare silently at the screen.:<PAGE>
Once the mission statement is complete, the screen urges them\nto enter the row of machines for rest and wound treatment.:<TAP>
\n\nEach girl replies with a single word: "Yes.":<TAP>
\nBut unlike the last time, they do not speak in unison.:<TAP>
\n\nThe screen falls dark.:<TAP>
\nThe girls follow orders and return to their coffins.:<PAGE>
Inside, the girl who closed her eyes cannot stop her thoughts.:<TAP>
\nThey estimated the number of dead and injured.:
\nThose deaths had been predicted from the start.:
\n\nI am alive.:
\nBut that only means I survived this day.:
\n\nIf I die tomorrow, I will be replaced. The fight will go on.:
She feels a sense of unease.:<TAP>
\nHer thoughts spin as she drops her gaze to her palms.:<TAP>
\n\nThere is nothing there.:<TAP>
\nPerhaps there had never been anything there.:
\n\nWhat was she trying to think of?:<TAP>
\nShe does not know.:<PAGE>
The machine fills with liquid. Her consciousness fades.:<TAP>
\n\nShe had felt something in her hand.:<TAP>
\nBut now she feels nothing.:<TAP>
\n\nHow can there be nothing?:<TAP>
\n\nHer question still unanswered, the girl slips into the dark.:<PAGE>
